intro: Micromeria kosaninii subsp. prilepensis, commonly known as the Prilep micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
